title: new data
excerpt: new shor blog
content:
The error 401 Unauthorized on a PUT request means your Backend is rejecting the update because it doesn't know who the user is.

This usually happens for one of two reasons:

Frontend: The blogApi.js is not sending the Session Cookie (credentials) with the request.

Backend: The updateBlog route is protected, and the authentication check is failing.

Here is the step-by-step fix.

Step 1: Fix Frontend src/api/blogApi.js (Critical)
You must ensure that the update function uses the api instance that has withCredentials: true. If you use plain axios.put, it won't send cookies.
author: admin
